name: Kronecker coefficient
explained: The Kronecker coefficient g(λ, μ, ν) is defined for three partitions λ, μ, ν of integers. It represents the multiplicity of the irreducible representation corresponding to the partition ν in the decomposition of the tensor product of the irreducible representations corresponding to partitions λ and μ under the symmetric group S_n (for sufficiently large n). In formulaic terms, g(λ, μ, ν) is the multiplicity of the irreducible character χ_ν in the product of the irreducible characters χ_λ and χ_μ. While Kronecker coefficients are defined for all partitions (with the convention that they vanish unless ν is contained in the 'direct sum' of λ and μ), they are particularly significant for partitions of the same integer n, where the symmetric group S_n acts. The challenge lies in computing these coefficients efficiently, which remains a difficult problem in algebraic combinatorics.
related_conjectures: Saxl conjecture (predicts the highest weight in the Kronecker product)
Foulkes conjecture (about Kronecker products of two equal partitions)
P vs NP problem (computing Kronecker coefficients is believed to be computationally hard)
